trans-unit.source: Policies in Azure API Management
trans-unit.target: Policies in Azure API Management

trans-unit.source: Learn how to create, edit, and configure policies in API Management.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to create, edit, and configure policies in API Management.

trans-unit.source: In Azure API Management, policies are a powerful capability of the system that allow the publisher to change the behavior of the API through configuration.
trans-unit.target: In Azure API Management, policies are a powerful capability of the system that allow the publisher to change the behavior of the API through configuration.

trans-unit.source: Policies are a collection of Statements that are executed sequentially on the request or response of an API.
trans-unit.target: Policies are a collection of Statements that are executed sequentially on the request or response of an API.

trans-unit.source: Popular Statements include format conversion from XML to JSON and call rate limiting to restrict the amount of incoming calls from a developer.
trans-unit.target: Popular Statements include format conversion from XML to JSON and call rate limiting to restrict the amount of incoming calls from a developer.

trans-unit.source: Many more policies are available out of the box.
trans-unit.target: Many more policies are available out of the box.

trans-unit.source: See the <linkText>Policy Reference</linkText><title></title> for a full list of policy statements and their settings.
trans-unit.target: See the <linkText>Policy Reference</linkText><title></title> for a full list of policy statements and their settings.

trans-unit.source: Policies are applied inside the proxy which sits between the API consumer and the managed API.
trans-unit.target: Policies are applied inside the proxy which sits between the API consumer and the managed API.

trans-unit.source: The proxy receives all requests and usually forwards them unaltered to the underlying API.
trans-unit.target: The proxy receives all requests and usually forwards them unaltered to the underlying API.

trans-unit.source: However a policy can apply changes to both the inbound request and outbound response.
trans-unit.target: However a policy can apply changes to both the inbound request and outbound response.

trans-unit.source: Policy expressions can be used as attribute values or text values in any of the API Management policies, unless the policy specifies otherwise.
trans-unit.target: Policy expressions can be used as attribute values or text values in any of the API Management policies, unless the policy specifies otherwise.

trans-unit.source: Some policies such as the <linkText>Control flow</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>Set variable</linkText><title></title> policies are based on policy expressions.
trans-unit.target: Some policies such as the <linkText>Control flow</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>Set variable</linkText><title></title> policies are based on policy expressions.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>Advanced policies</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>Policy expressions</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>Advanced policies</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>Policy expressions</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Policies can be configured globally or at the scope of a <linkText>Product</linkText><title></title>, <linkText>API</linkText><title></title> or <linkText>Operation</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Policies can be configured globally or at the scope of a <linkText>Product</linkText><title></title>, <linkText>API</linkText><title></title> or <linkText>Operation</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: To configure a policy, navigate to the Policies editor in the Publisher Portal.
trans-unit.target: To configure a policy, navigate to the Policies editor in the Publisher Portal.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Policies menu</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Policies menu</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The policies editor consists of three main sections: the policy scope (top), the policy definition where policies are edited (left) and the statements list (right):
trans-unit.target: The policies editor consists of three main sections: the policy scope (top), the policy definition where policies are edited (left) and the statements list (right):

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Policies editor</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Policies editor</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To begin configuring a policy you must first select the scope at which the policy should apply.
trans-unit.target: To begin configuring a policy you must first select the scope at which the policy should apply.

trans-unit.source: In the screenshot below the Starter product is selected.
trans-unit.target: In the screenshot below the Starter product is selected.

trans-unit.source: Note that the square symbol next to the policy name indicates that a policy is already applied at this level.
trans-unit.target: Note that the square symbol next to the policy name indicates that a policy is already applied at this level.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scope</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scope</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Since a policy has already been applied, the configuration is shown in the definition view.
trans-unit.target: Since a policy has already been applied, the configuration is shown in the definition view.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The policy is displayed read-only at first.
trans-unit.target: The policy is displayed read-only at first.

trans-unit.source: In order to edit the definition click the Configure Policy action.
trans-unit.target: In order to edit the definition click the Configure Policy action.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Edit</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Edit</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The policy definition is a simple XML document that describes a sequence of inbound and outbound statements.
trans-unit.target: The policy definition is a simple XML document that describes a sequence of inbound and outbound statements.

trans-unit.source: The XML can be edited directly in the definition window.
trans-unit.target: The XML can be edited directly in the definition window.

trans-unit.source: A list of statements is provided to the right and statements applicable to the current scope are enabled and highlighted; as demonstrated by the Limit Call Rate statement in the screenshot above.
trans-unit.target: A list of statements is provided to the right and statements applicable to the current scope are enabled and highlighted; as demonstrated by the Limit Call Rate statement in the screenshot above.

trans-unit.source: Clicking an enabled statement will add the appropriate XML at the location of the cursor in the definition view.
trans-unit.target: Clicking an enabled statement will add the appropriate XML at the location of the cursor in the definition view.

trans-unit.source: A full list of policy statements and their settings are available in the <linkText>Policy Reference</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: A full list of policy statements and their settings are available in the <linkText>Policy Reference</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: For example, to add a new statement to restrict incoming requests to specified IP addresses, place the cursor just inside the content of the "inbound" XML element and click the Restrict caller IPs statement.
trans-unit.target: For example, to add a new statement to restrict incoming requests to specified IP addresses, place the cursor just inside the content of the "inbound" XML element and click the Restrict caller IPs statement.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Restriction policies</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Restriction policies</linkText>

trans-unit.source: This will add an XML snippet to the "inbound" element that provides guidance on how to configure the statement.
trans-unit.target: This will add an XML snippet to the "inbound" element that provides guidance on how to configure the statement.

trans-unit.source: To limit inbound requests and accept only those from an IP address of 1.2.3.4 modify the XML as follows:
trans-unit.target: To limit inbound requests and accept only those from an IP address of 1.2.3.4 modify the XML as follows:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Save</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Save</linkText>

trans-unit.source: When complete configuring the statements for the policy, click Save and the changes will be propagated to the API Management proxy immediately.
trans-unit.target: When complete configuring the statements for the policy, click Save and the changes will be propagated to the API Management proxy immediately.

trans-unit.source: A policy is a series of statements that execute in order for a request and a response.
trans-unit.target: A policy is a series of statements that execute in order for a request and a response.

trans-unit.source: The configuration is divided appropriately into an inbound (request) and outbound (policy) as shown in the configuration.
trans-unit.target: The configuration is divided appropriately into an inbound (request) and outbound (policy) as shown in the configuration.

trans-unit.source: Since policies can be specified at different levels (global, product, api and operation) then the configuration provides a way for you to specify the order in which this definition's statements execute with respect to the parent policy.
trans-unit.target: Since policies can be specified at different levels (global, product, api and operation) then the configuration provides a way for you to specify the order in which this definition's statements execute with respect to the parent policy.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you have a policy at the global level and a policy configured for an API, then whenever that particular API is used - both policies will be applied.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you have a policy at the global level and a policy configured for an API, then whenever that particular API is used - both policies will be applied.

trans-unit.source: API Management allows for deterministic ordering of combined policy statements via the base element.
trans-unit.target: API Management allows for deterministic ordering of combined policy statements via the base element.

trans-unit.source: In the example policy definition above, the cross-domain statement would execute before any higher policies which would in turn, be followed by the find-and-replace policy.
trans-unit.target: In the example policy definition above, the cross-domain statement would execute before any higher policies which would in turn, be followed by the find-and-replace policy.

trans-unit.source: Note: A global policy has no parent policy and using the element in it has no effect.
trans-unit.target: Note: A global policy has no parent policy and using the element in it has no effect.

trans-unit.source: Check out following video on policy expressions.
trans-unit.target: Check out following video on policy expressions.
